items.name: Chocolate Cake
items.recipe: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, combine flour, cocoa, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Add buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla; beat on low speed for 30 seconds. Beat on high speed for 2 minutes. Stir in hot water (batter will be thin). Pour batter into prepared pans. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans to wire racks. Cool completely.

items.name: Strawberry Cheesecake
ingredients: 32 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
items.recipe: Preheat oven to 325°F. In a large bowl, mix together graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and sugar. Press mixture into bottom and up sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Bake crust for 10 minutes. Let cool. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until creamy. Add sugar and vanilla extract; beat until smooth. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in heavy cream. Pour half of the cheesecake mixture into crust. Spoon strawberry puree over cheesecake mixture. Pour remaining cheesecake mixture over strawberry puree. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until center is set. Turn off the oven and let cheesecake cool in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool to room temperature. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving.

1. Squeeze the juice from 4 lemons into a pitcher.
2. Add 4 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar to the pitcher and stir until the sugar dissolves.
3. Add a handful of fresh mint leaves to the pitcher and stir.
4. Chill the lemonade in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.
items.name: Lemonade with Mint

items.description: A simple yet delicious iced tea.
items.recipe:
1. Boil 4 cups of water in a pot.
2. Remove the pot from the heat and add 4 tea bags.
3. Steep the tea for 5 minutes.
4. Remove the tea bags and add 1/2 cup of sugar to the pot. Stir until the sugar dissolves.
5. Let the tea cool to room temperature, then chill it in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
6. Cut a lemon into slices and add them to the tea before serving.
items.name: Iced Tea with Lemon

items.recipe:
1. Cook pasta according to the package instructions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water. 
2. In a saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. 
3. Add heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Stir until the cheese has melted and the sauce is smooth. 
4. Add cooked pasta to the saucepan and stir to combine. 
5. Add reserved pasta cooking water as needed to thin out the sauce. 
6. Serve immediately and enjoy!
items.name: Creamy Parmesan Pasta

items.description: Juicy roasted chicken with crispy skin
items.recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. 
2. Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels. 
3. In a bowl, mix softened butter, minced garlic, lemon zest, salt, and black pepper. 
4. Carefully loosen the skin of the chicken and spread the butter mixture under the skin. Rub the remaining butter mixture over the outside of the chicken. 
5. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 50-60 minutes, until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. 
6. Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving. 
7. Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
items.name: Garlic Butter Roasted Chicken

items.recipe:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 
2. Cut the carrots and potatoes into bite-sized pieces. 
3. Slice the onions and chop the garlic. 
4. In a bowl, toss the vegetables with olive oil, salt, and pepper. 
5. Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. 
6. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender and golden brown.
items.name: Roasted Vegetables

items.recipe:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). 
2. Slice the baguette into pieces. 
3. Melt the butter and mix in the chopped garlic. 
4. Brush the garlic butter onto the bread. 
5. Bake in the oven for 10-12 minutes or until crispy and golden brown.
items.name: Garlic Bread
